Évaluation publiée le 27 juin 2017
I wanted the full experience of stumbling around an unknown spaceship desperately trying to work out how to survive long enough to reenter correctly without dying, so I selected hard mode to start with. This mode disables a little tutorial describing the spaceship at the beginning of the game, and also removes hilighting on which buttons to push.

In hard mode, I died twice, and then landed safely after about an hour of gameplay, at which point the game was basically done. I tried to aim the spaceship retrograde and deorbit manually far ahead of the script, but it didn't do anything. As far as I can tell, the spaceship is on rails (you can't actually fly and watch the oribital mechanics play out; you have one path and you die if you get too far off it).

I can still hartily reccomend the game, though, because for the ~1 hour of gameplay, it did really feel like flying a spaceship, and it was awesome. Figuring out how things worked in hard mode was panic-filled and I died twice, but that's the fun of the adventure. I RECCOMEND ALL PLAYERS PLAY ON HARD MODE THE FIRST TIME. Having buttons hilighted when you need to press them takes away the main gameplay mechanic: figuring out how the spaceship works. On easy mode, you just follow the linear course of events, and working the fiddly life-support system quickly becomes frustrating. On hard mode, you need to think and work fast but also carefully to learn how to fly the spaceship without breaking it or running out of time. On easy mode, it's a movie that you have to play minigames to continue. On hard mode, it's a game.

tl;dr: Only one hour of gameplay, but very fun. Play on hard mode; easy mode takes away too much gameplay and makes it boring.

Évaluation publiée le 19 juillet 2017
В полном восторге от игры.

Суть: ваша задача следить за показаниями приборов, выполнять указания диспетчера, приземлиться и при этом выжить. По ходу игра органично пытается ввести вас в стрессовую ситуацию из-за уровня кислорода, давления, CO2, отказов и необходимости искать нужную кнопку.

На фоне этого разворачивается эпическая история в духе (клюквы) времён холодной войны. За историю и переговоры диспетчеров поставил бы отдельные пять баллов, а также юмор разработчиков.

Два режима сложности, которые отличаются тем, будут ли вам подсвечивать элементы управления (куда сейчас нужно нажать) или нет. После легкого уровня сразу советую пройти игру на харде. Есть два варианта развязки не считая вашей гибели.

С технической точки зрения всё идеально вылизано и детализировано. Баги не замечены.

[Минусы]

1. Чтобы получить удовольствие от игры вы должны воспринимать английский язык на слух (базовый уровень + немного терминологии связанной с сеттингом: oxugen, thrusters, etc.). Потому, что без понимания, что говорит вам диспетчер вы не поймёте ни сюжет, ни ситуацию, ни самое главное, КУДА Б%Я#Ь ТЫКАТЬ! Из-за этого ваш пукан подгорит, и вы влепите игре незаслуженный негативный отзыв.

2. Игра очень короткая.

За 1.5 часа я успел пройти её два раза, но блин, это стоило каждого рубля.

Ставлю 10 разводных ключей из 10.

P.S.: Проходил с помощью Oculus Rift + Touch

In this episode, Genna doesn't know who he is. In space. Click here to Subscribe ► http://bit.ly/mrwssub ▬▬▬▬ GAME INFO ▬▬▬▬ Buy Interkosmos ► http://bit.ly/2q38IT3 My written Steam Review ►...


Written Review
Interkosmos is a very cool mix of a funny and ominous game.

You start off the game in a space shuttle, with a lengthy tutorial that will teach you what every single button and switch does. You might feel overwhelmed at first, but you will learn it as time goes on. And when you do, it will feel very satisfying. Hearing "your oxygen is low" and then your hand automatically snaps to the right lever to let in some oxygen, while at the same time depressurizing the cabin so you don't die is a very cool feeling.

The graphics look great, by the way. It's very immersive. Especially since you're an astronaut, so you've got a big bulky helmet on. It perfectly excuses the feeling you have from wearing the VR headset.

The story is one of the best parts of the game. Because of that, I will not spoil anything. I will just tell you that it unravels slowly, and you learn new information as time goes on. Sometimes it will make you laugh, sometimes it will put you on edge. You can make small choices that impact the game slightly, but the gameplay will not really change much.

One thing that bothered me was, your hands aren't positioned correctly. They are rotated 90 degrees the wrong way, and are too far away from you. It's hard to explain, but you'll feel that disconnect when you are actually in VR. It wasn't too bad, and you get used to it after a while, but there were a few times where I struggled to press something because my fingers weren't where I expected them to be. Hopefully it's something the devs can easily fix in the future.

It's quite a short experience, but man it's such a good one. I beat it in about 1 hour, and although it doesn't have much replay value, I would definitely recommend people try it out. I think it's best to not know much about the story and just dive in. Recommended!

Évaluation publiée le 7 novembre 2017
Considering the premium you pay for some more lackluster VR experiences, Interkosmos is a steal for the price. It's a short-ish "follow these instructions before you die" kind of experience, but the funny writing and loving attention to detail really makes it stand out.

I love the Soviet-era space program - the bravery, the audacity, the technical ingenuity... and Interkosmos captures this perfectly, from the glitchy flight computer to the chunky switches and handles. I loved the tactile sensation and "clunkiness" of the Soviet control panels, and it really makes the most of VR by sticking you in a claustrophobic cockpit. The humour, in the form of messages from ground control, brings it all together.

It's short, but it's funny, beautiful and engaging - all the things I'm looking for from VR. You probably won't get more than an hour out of it but it's great fun all the same.

Évaluation publiée le 21 février 2020
申し訳程度にストーリーがある、着座で遊べるVR冷戦時代の宇宙飛行士体験ゲー。
面白い面白くないは抜きにして、わりと嫌いになれない感じのゲームなのでサムズアップ。


ただし登山でいうなら下山のみ。打上げとかドッキングとか船外活動とか無重力環境での実験とかそういうの全部済んでる。衛星軌道にいる宇宙ステーションの再突入カプセル内で始まり、分離して地球への帰還を目指すだけ。

とは言え搭載コンピュータはファミコン並の時代なので、ほぼすべてがマニュアル操作。色んなバルブを取っ替え引っ替え開け閉めしてカプセル内の気温・気圧・酸素濃度・二酸化炭素濃度を保ちつつ、適切な再突入軌道に乗せなきゃいけない。

なのに無線で指示をくれるロシア人とアメリカ人がそれぞれ勝手な言い分で言い争い始めたりする。よしわかったから落ち着けお前ら。なんかコードを入力しろって言う前に、まず俺に「ВВОД」と「ОЧИС.」のどっちがエンターキーなのか教えろ。決定できねえ。


多少操作性に難はありつつも、大量の操作パネルに囲まれてるとまあまあ何かしらのパイロット気分は味わえる。ただし言語依存度はめっちゃ高い。無線指示に字幕はないので英語音声のヒアリング必須。それも半分はモーターがモルタルになっちゃうくらいのロシア訛り。

まあそうだよね、宇宙飛行士だもん。英語必須だよね。そこはバーチャルであって欲しかった……。

非常有趣的游戏，但对英语水平有一定要求。
以下可能存在剧透。
游戏中玩家将会扮演一名完成任务并即将返航的苏联宇航员，在莫斯科方面用电台指挥其返航的过程中因为地面方面出现差错，以至于失去了可用的降落坐标。这时候美国休斯敦方面闯入了电台频率，声称可以提供安全的降落坐标保证宇航员能够安全返航，莫斯科方面一开始不同意，要求休斯敦离开该频率，并告知休斯敦：“这是苏联的宇航员，这是苏联的英雄，休斯敦不要来插手！”在经过一番美苏混合指挥的闹剧之后，莫斯科方面终于同意将宇航员交予休斯敦指挥。最后宇航员在休斯敦的指挥下安全着陆。
完全不会英语的人是没办法进行游戏的，因为不论是莫斯科还是休斯敦，他们都会指挥你对计算机输入代码，不输入代码游戏就不能继续。
这对小学时曾经努力学习过英语的同学来说是有优势的。

Évaluation publiée le 25 avril 2017
I truly enjoyed playing in this fictional Soviet spacecraft hurtling across planet earth, pulling levers switches and pushing buttons that do important things. Lot's of fun and after a bunch of deaths made it safely back to earth!

Sound design was great, and helped with immersion. From radio chatter with ground control to the chunky metal clanks of buttons levers switches and hatches or the hiss of leaking gasses and electrical shorts.

The instructions over the radio were good, as I frantically searched for the needed buttons\ panels in russian and little english subtitled labels.

Loved how I felt busy keeping myself alive.

For 4.99 Interkosmos delivers a lot for space junkies, and/or button nerds. (Me) I truly felt like I was in charge of my destiny in this tin can. I had some difficulty with my virtual hands switching on or off certain buttons/covers which made things more tense but a bit frustrating. Hopefully we will see some control tweaks.

I wish I had seen some ingame death sequences which would have added much more replayability other than a simple text explanation as to what I did wrong.

I do wish this experience is expanded and polished up as it's fun and addictive.
Now back to floating in my tin can.

Évaluation publiée le 19 juin 2017
Fantastic concept. Fun to play. but absurdly frustrating. It has this loop that happens every 30ish seconds that is fun the first two times it happens, then it starts being annoying:

0. Get yelled at by Russian that the pressure is too high
1. fight with the stupid hitbox issues so you can turn the valves to release the pressure.
2. finally open the valves.
3. try to close the valves, (this is usually easier than step 2 if you don't take your hands off them)
4. Get yelled at by Russian that your O2 levels are too low.
5. refill the O2 you just vented into space. (again, with hitbox combat)
6. Get yelled at by Russian that your O2 levels are too high.
7. Vent atmosphere into space.
8. Get yelled at by Russian that you are off course.
9. fight with the absurdly fiddly joystick to get back on course
10. Repeat steps 9 and 10 4 times.
11. GoTo 0. (by this time its taken so long to do all the other steps that the pressure is too high again.)

If you are lucky enough (and skilled enough) to get all that done in good time, get ready to do it all again in about 30 seconds.

And it never stops. You have to do that same thing over and over again. sometimes you get a break from the yelling Russian because other story line audio clips start playing so you get some brief respite. But you will never be free of it.

If they get rid of this stupid feedback loop, or at least make it so it is FAR LESS frequent, AND fix all the fiddly issues with collisions for the control panels, Then I recommend you play this game. Because it is beautiful, and a great concept.

NOTE TO POTENTIAL VR GAME DEVS: You SHOULD play this game, despite its issues. Because this core concept is a great thing that we need more of in VR. and while this one has been executed poorly, there's a lot to learn for us game devs.

Évaluation publiée le 3 aout 2020
This game is a little hard to describe, i personally thought it was going to be an "escape the room" kinda game.

But its more like a narrative experience, you do interact, by pressing a lot of buttons and turning dials and other stuff you do every day in a russian space capsule, but there arent any "puzzles", only needing to find the right button .

your space capsule feels really good, although the buttons and levers sometimes feel weird? like when i grabbed a dial it was already "turned" before i actually twisted my hand.

As far as i can tell the difference between hard and easy mode is that in easy mode you get a small tutorial, and buttons are highlighted when needed... playing it once on easy, should be enough to be able to play the 2nd time on hard.

Personally i felt easy was WAY to easy and hard was a bit more fun and hectic. Learning the layout before starting helps obviously.

Took me ~40min my 1st run on easy, and it kinda feel "on rails" so the lenght might be somewhat fixed.

The strongest thing on its favor i think its the writing, the dialogue is really witty and funny. But aside that it was a very enjoyable experience, i recommend playing on easy for the storyline, or on hard if you want some hectic button pressing and dial turning.

Évaluation publiée le 4 juillet 2021
On easy mode I'd say that this would make a fairly decent introduction to VR in that it basically tells you what to do and you sit back and enjoy the experience. In hard mode this is something more like a themed escape room (all be it a little more hectic and less logical) where you are receiving radio messages and you have to figure out what the heck they are talking about and what you need to press. It can be really easy to overlook something important and this can end up with you crashing and burning with no clue as to what went wrong so you'll probably end up trying it a couple of times, but once you have a good idea of where the various systems are it's pretty easy. I'd definitely recommend playing on hard mode. It's very short but I picked it up on sale and don't regret the purchase.

Évaluation publiée le 15 aout 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Interkosmos ci mette nei panni di un cosmonauta russo che deve far rientrare sulla terra una capsula di una stazione spaziale.

Che dire, l'ho ottenuto gratis durante un giveaway a maggio 2020. È un gioco molto semplice, ascolti ciò che ti dicono alla radio e premi i vari bottoni evidenziati per evitare di morire. (o, se giochi a modalità difficile, i bottoni non vengono evidenziati). Mi ha divertito, ma dura neanche 1 ora e non credo sia molto rigiocabile, visto che presenta solo la fase di rientro sulla terra. Il prezzo che chiedono di 5€, mi sembra onesto, ma... è un gioco vecchio, quando il VR era ancora all'inizio. Non supporta il finger tracking dell'Index, viene mostrato il controller del Vive in game, i comandi sono molto basilari ma allo stesso tempo "obsoleti", tipo: se muovi gli analogici, parte un menu di pausa e se sfiori il trackpad si centra la visuale. Insomma, ci troviamo davvero all'inizio di questa tecnologia.

Lo consiglio, perchè comunque è carina come idea.

Évaluation publiée le 6 mars 2018
Mélange savoureux de mini jeu d'aventure et de simulation, très drôle et parfaitement réalisé. Une petite merveille.

Malheureusement il faut un niveau d'anglais correct pour pouvoir en profiter. Les instructions viennent en anglais et si vous ne comprenez pas bien vous n'en profiterez pas vraiment. Vous pourrez vous en sortir en mode facile mais ce sera dommage.

Un point important évoqué dans d'autres commentaires: sauf justement gros soucis linguistique, ne jouez pas en mode facile, essayez directement difficile c'est beaucoup plus sympa. En mode facile on vous dit ou appuyez à chaque étape, ça dénature le jeu.

Évaluation publiée le 20 aout 2020
+Really Fun!
+Escape-Room-esque
+Price is good for the content.
+Replayable

-Glitches sometimes and you get stuck

3/5
This is a very enjoyable little experience where you're trapped in a cockpit you're not supposed to be in hurling back towards earth while trying to figure out how to not die before you hit the ground. You're narrated the entire time when something starts to mess up, and originally told how to fix the problem. After that it's just a race against time to save yourself from hitting earth and blowing up. I'd definitely recommend picking it up if you like somewhat intense, quick thinking, timed puzzle/escape kind of games.

Évaluation publiée le 31 aout 2017
A fun little game worth the 5 euro.

as you can see in the video you are in a space capsul, and your goal is to land on earth.
You will be given some instructions to follow but you soon will realize that there are some hard choises to make
since the radio operator(s) have a different view upon things. And it dosent help that Nasa try to contact you and ask you to do things while Russia say something els... it is up to you to deside what you want to do sometimes ;-)

But all in all what you do in the game is sit in your capsul and open/close your oxygen, flip some switchen, and reset fuses.
And at some point you have to aim your capsul in the right direction and click some other buttons.
On easy level some of the keys light up when you have to press them.
Most of the time the story and buttons lighten up and are easy to find, while other times you can get a bit confused.

The game is funny ( the audio / story ) .. the game feel like you get a new command every 30 seconds... Check oxygen, overpresure release gas, change to backup power ect ect ect. do this and do that all the way from start to finish.

As you progress in the story it will unlock so you in the main menu can quick start and example try again where you died.
I would not say the game have that much replay value, but you might be interested in trying to complete the story in one go without dying.

For the 5 euro it cost It is a nice short experience. For 5 euro you should try it though you maybe only play it a few times.

- I think the part about the landing gear is a bit comfusing, dont really know where the disable landing gear button is even though i managed to land on earth ;-)

TIP..: The best way to control your oxygen and presure, is to turn the handle near your left knee, and look left and avoid overpresure... now stop, and look right and see if you can reduce the c02 level and fill more in your tank.. Just keep looking left and right and you refil without much problems.
And note that you do not have to run all systems on your primary battery, but example can make one of them run on the backup so you avoid over voltage. :-)

Ps.. Played with Oculus rift + touch controlers. working.. you can grab things, and click buttons with one finger. ( the ocolus touch controllers are fantastic for this game ).
And i played with Pimax 4k and Nolo controllers... The vr headset is very good for this game and image quality is good.... The controllers.. they work, but i had no success using the power handle i could not grap it.. dont know if this was a one time issue.
I also played the game with pimax 5k+ and the new vive index controllers and vive index base station.. In general i recommend to sit on a char example 2m from your computer where you have room to stretch your arms in any direction.
( i think i bought interkosmos on ocolus and then i use Revive to play it in steam, maybe there is a little conflict or something.. Revivew is a mod that allow you to play ocolus games via steam or other vr equipment, and it work really great mostly. ).

Évaluation publiée le 18 aout 2019
The Arcade Version of Apollo 11

As the title indicates, you've got a space capsule landing simulator, but without the technical acumen needed in real life..
Thankfully, the developers put in a funny story to guide you through the landing procedure that made the moments between the landing procedure very enjoyable.
Although he game is recommended for siting, I played it standing up, only because my chair has a high neck rest on it, making it more difficult to see and operate the parachute controls. With that being said, standing up was nor a problem; no dizziness.

I played with a Rift S and a i7-8700/16GB RAM/GTX 1070Ti set up. Other than my Touch controller orientation being off by 45 degress (compared to my real life orientation), some occassional lag when moving the touch controllers, and having to touch buttons repeatedly on occassion, it was a pretty smooth experience.

Because I can be pretty dense following instructions, I finally got through the game in about 2.0 hours. For a $5 game, that is a pretty good return on investment..

The game was fun, entertaining, absolutely no motion sickness I could detect, decent controls, and (to quote my significant other) cheap. Well worth the time to play.

Évaluation publiée le 26 juin 2017
This is a short, but highly endearing game about the space race where you play as a hapless Kosmonaut struggling to juggle the controls of a rusted out Russian capsule. The sense of presence is pretty strong considering the stationary location, but I didn't feel that my hands were oriented correctly on either the Vive or the Touch (this is motion controls only) and my body felt like it was hovering a bit higher than it should have even after recentering the view - not that either of these things greatly effected my overall enjoyment. The banter from your handlers in mission control are comical, and the slapdash nature of the whole affair makes this game something fun to pull out when friends pop by to check out some VR. I also want to try playing the game again in Hard difficulty, now that I feel more comfortable, but I'd say the $5 I spent on this little gem was worth it for even just the initial hour long playthough I had on easy difficulty. It's an amusing little experience that would not be possible without VR, and I can recommend it for it's humor and sense immersion.

Évaluation publiée le 11 novembre 2018
So I'm recommending this game, but it's definitely got flaws.

Firstly, this is a short and simple game. Do yourself a favour and go straight for Hard Mode. You're railroaded through the entire game, but at least you have the freedom to mess up and select the wrong buttons!

Secondly, there are various controls that appear to never be used at all during a successful playthrough. It would be great if there was more flexibility or some kind of free play mode to experiment with these, without a Russian Cosmonaut shouting in my ear.

On the pros: graphics are very well done (although I had to turn off High Quality to get it to run smoothly on my overclocked 1070) and the gameplay is fast-paced and fun.

Low replayability in my opinion. Once you've sussed out the controls, that's kind of it for the game.

At the low price that the game is sold at? Buy it, it's a fun hour. But don't expect to keep coming back to the game.

Hey you! Have you ever seen those old space capsules in museums and thought, “damn, i’d love to press those buttons and pretend i know what im doing”? Haven’t we all? Boy, have I got a game for you!

I bought this game earlier tonight and played through the entire game in about 3 or so hours. Although it’s very short, a lot of care went into it, and it definitely shows. This game reminds me of Papers, Please and Please Don’t Touch Anything, except in VR. The simple “click” and vibration you get every time you press a button or flick a switch is simply the most satisfying thing in any game ever. Plus, you can hit things with a wrench. The game’s humor is unique and charming, and the voice acting is top quality compared to other titles on the VR market. I really enjoyed this game, and I hope the devs make more for games in the future. Definitely worth the price. 9/10

Évaluation publiée le 17 décembre 2017
I think this is a good buy for the price. Although it's short you've got some reasonably good voice acting, very good graphics and a good sense of presence.

When you flip a toggle switch it feels stiff. I'm not sure how they achieved this, it could be the sound or maybe a subtle stopping of your in-game finger? The buttons are the same - very satisfying feedback - you know when you've pushed that button!

I really felt that I was sat in a confined pod. I've yet to make a successful landing despite hundreds of hours on Kerbal Space Program :-)

The game doesn't perform great although it's playable on my 1060 GTX, lots of reprojection though the motion controls just about keep up. This is at 1.2 SS which doesn't seem amazing considering the small environment.

For £3.99 it's worth a punt, that's less than the price of breakfast in MacDonalds and Interkosmos is a lot more enjoyable!

Évaluation publiée le 24 juillet 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

A short VR game that was given out on Steam once. It places you in a cold war-era Soviet shuttle, which just undocked from the space station without the right pilot. It's up to the player to follow the instructions from the comrades to safely return to earth.

Never before in my early VR phase has such a game made me both laugh and yet feel a tad bit uneasy. The shuttle controls that are laid out in front of me is numerous and can be daunting for new players, not least for those that don't know Russian. Fortunately, all the important controls have the English translation stuck next to them and the radio communication will give you instructions follow the right sequence and solutions. The interface will highlight the controls when you're about to use them for the first time, so that's an appreciated help. The outcome of your actions will depend on your control accuracy, timing and attention to some details (ie. regulating O2 values). Despite working in a delicate and relatively complex environment, the humor from hearing your colleagues reacting to different situations (along with mock Russian accents) got me snickering and lightens the mood.

Despite the balances in mood and steep learning curve that evens out further, I stumbled upon some control bug that prevents me from grabbing onto vital objects and left me fumbling around during the landing phase (I'm playing on Oculus Quest). Completionists should note that the achievement system is broken and will be left unfulfilled after finishing the game.

Nevertheless, it's a fun and educational experience that took me roughly an hour to see myself to one of the branched goals. 5€ value is just good enough for you to act as a shuttle pilot but if you're still on the fence, wait for the sale or another giveaway.
 
Jevnation ♫

Норвежский сливочный суп с семгой
вода — 500 мл;
филе семги — 370 г;
картофель — 500 г;
помидоры — 300 г;
морковь — 150 г;
лук – 100 г;
сливки 10% — 500 мл;
растительное масло, зелень, соль, перец.
Нарежьте лук помельче, натрите морковь на мелкой терке. Очистите картофель и снимите кожицу с помидоров (если хотите). Картофель и помидоры нарежьте кубиками.

Налейте на дно кастрюли немного растительного масла и обжарьте лук, морковь и помидоры. Затем влейте в кастрюлю воду и доведите до кипения.

Добавьте картофель, соль и специи по вкусу и варите около семи минут. Затем добавьте семгу, медленно влейте сливки и варите до готовности картофеля.

Блюдо украсьте свежей зеленью. Но учтите, такому супу лучше настояться. Так что после того, как снимите его с плиты – дайте ему постоять около получаса и только потом подавайте. Можно добавить в тарелку ломтик лимона. Он придаст пикантности.


Готовить - это просто =)

Évaluation publiée le 29 juin 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

While being a fun overall VR experience, Interkosmos feels just way too simple. It puts the player on a very specific set of actions they must perform in order for something to happen, while constantly flicking the switch to filter CO2 and twisting a handle to let more oxygen in.

If it was expanded into a simple space flight game (doesn't even need to be a 100% simulator, but rather an "arcade" experience, which allows the player to fly around, dock and do various space missions), then it would be a much more fun and rewarding experience.

Besides that, it is unoptimized. My rig is pretty simple, a 7th gen i5, GTX 1080 and 16gb RAM, but it ran hotter than in Half-Life Alyx, Boneworks or Pavlov.

Spending any amount of money on this short mini-game is insane. But if there is a possibility of playing it for free, go and try it.

Évaluation publiée le 11 juin 2020
Produit reçu gratuitement

Well... I gave it a go. Given away for free, so I figured I might as well... First red flag being with the hands.
They are clearly "hands on sticks" when it comes to the Vive Wands.
When we're talking about the Index controllers, that means that the hands are almost a foot away from your own and completely out of orientation.
The only hand pose is a pointed finger for pushing buttons, for which the only finger that needs to be retracted is the index finger with a trigger pull, so the exact opposite of what feels natural.
This is of course after spending nearly 20 minutes fiddling with Open Input Emulator to offset the controllers so that the in game hands would follow some semblance of the positioning of my IRL hands. The 90 degrees out of angle being particularly egregarious as after fixing that transform the other two rotations end up bound to the same axis (not a fault of this game per ce, but still vexing)

The following tutorial was rushed, and due to grabbing valves not being entirely as smooth as it could have been, I was still fumbling with setting them right, and trying to make sure the overly suspicios fire was out and O2 levels were correct, while the voice was already blathering on about the next set of controls.

It was at this point that my thumb brushed the trackpad, which sent me right back to the main menu.
I'm calling it a day at this point. I shall probably revisit this title later, but there are games that I paid for that I shall play through first before struggling with this one again, but for now, the hurdles of getting into the game were a bit too much.
Unfortunately, a bit more thought into how the control setup and controller/hand placement was configured (and most particularly an index controller update, just to get the correct offsets out of the box) would have done wonders.

I'd have loved for this review to actually have been on the content of the game itself, as it looked to be detailed on a technical level, and who knows what has been added on top, but VR is all about the interactions, and while it doesn't fall flat there, there is a barrier between myself and the game at this point that needs to be overcome.

Received free in steam giveaway.

Évaluation publiée le 24 mai 2020
В полном восторге от игры.

Суть: ваша задача следить за показаниями приборов, выполнять указания диспетчера, приземлиться и при этом выжить. По ходу игра органично пытается ввести вас в стрессовую ситуацию из-за уровня кислорода, давления, CO2, отказов и необходимости искать нужную кнопку.

На фоне этого разворачивается эпическая история в духе (клюквы) времён холодной войны. За историю и переговоры диспетчеров поставил бы отдельные пять баллов, а также юмор разработчиков.

Два режима сложности, которые отличаются тем, будут ли вам подсвечивать элементы управления (куда сейчас нужно нажать) или нет. После легкого уровня сразу советую пройти игру на харде. Есть два варианта развязки не считая вашей гибели.

С технической точки зрения всё идеально вылизано и детализировано. Баги не замечены.

[Минусы]

1. Чтобы получить удовольствие от игры вы должны воспринимать английский язык на слух (базовый уровень + немного терминологии связанной с сеттингом: oxugen, thrusters, etc.). Потому, что без понимания, что говорит вам диспетчер вы не поймёте ни сюжет, ни ситуацию, ни самое главное, КУДА Б%Я#Ь ТЫКАТЬ! Из-за этого ваш пукан подгорит, и вы влепите игре незаслуженный негативный отзыв.

2. Игра очень короткая.

За 1.5 часа я успел пройти её два раза, но блин, это стоило каждого рубля.

Ставлю 10 разводных ключей из 10.

Interkosmos - Uma Viagem Espacial Imersiva e Envolvente

Avaliação do jogo: Interkosmos

Interkosmos é uma experiência de realidade virtual que coloca os jogadores no papel de astronautas, embarcando em uma emocionante viagem espacial. Avaliaremos Interkosmos como uma experiência imersiva e envolvente, onde os jogadores podem explorar o espaço sideral e enfrentar desafios únicos da vida no espaço.

Realidade Virtual Cativante
Uma das principais características do jogo é a sua jogabilidade de realidade virtual, que proporciona uma experiência imersiva e realista de estar no espaço.

Viagem Espacial Desafiadora
Interkosmos oferece uma viagem espacial desafiadora, onde os jogadores devem lidar com ambientes hostis, realizar tarefas complexas e tomar decisões cruciais para garantir o sucesso da missão.

Ambientes Espaciais Autênticos
O jogo recria ambientes espaciais autênticos, permitindo aos jogadores explorarem espaçonaves detalhadas e planetas misteriosos.

História Envolvente
Interkosmos apresenta uma história envolvente, com personagens cativantes e reviravoltas emocionantes, que mantêm os jogadores imersos na narrativa.

Gráficos e Som Impecáveis
Com gráficos e som impecáveis, o jogo cria uma atmosfera envolvente e realista, tornando a experiência espacial ainda mais emocionante.

Conclusão
Interkosmos é uma viagem espacial imersiva e envolvente, que permite aos jogadores vivenciarem a emocionante vida de astronautas no espaço. Com sua realidade virtual cativante, viagem espacial desafiadora, ambientes espaciais autênticos, história envolvente, gráficos e som impecáveis, o jogo oferece uma experiência única para os fãs de jogos de realidade virtual e exploração espacial. Se você busca uma aventura espacial emocionante e realista, Interkosmos é uma escolha recomendada para explorar o vasto cosmos e vivenciar a emocionante jornada como um astronauta!

Nota: 9/10

Interkosmos is a VR space capsule simulator. You will be told to do various small tasks and while there are achievements for this game, you will not earn them upon accomplishing any tasks. Interkosmos strives to be a short experience with little to no replay value. The graphics are nice, but the game seems to perform poorly at times. Some good things are that it is affordable at only $5. Its easy to play and understand.

Évaluation publiée le 6 mars 2023
un peu court, mais très sympa.

Le principe est un peu celui de I expect you to die, c'est à dire qu'on va devoir interagir au bon moment avec les commandes autour de sois afin de rentrer sur terre cet espèce de simili vieux soyouz.

Techniquement, c'est joli mais sans plus.
Il y a une bonne dose d'humour

Le principal soucis vient sans doute de sa durée de vie. C'est un peu comme si on n'avait qu'un tuto. Il faut un peu de temps pour assimiler les diverses commandes, mais à peine on commence à s'y retrouver que c'est déjà la fin. On a un mode facile qui met en surbrillance les commandes à actionner, ce qui certes peut être commode dans un tuto mais n'a pas d’intérêt en jeu et un mode difficile où il n'y a pas de surbrillance, ce qui rend la découverte plus difficile, mais surement plus intéressante

Je recommanderais de le faire en difficile, vu sa courte durée de vie et sa faible rejouabilité

Produit reçu gratuitement

A really cool VR concept and piece of abandonware in the making. Functionally runs well enough, needed to scale down the resolution a bit and overall a worthwhile experience even if replayablity is questionable (its a linear game experience).

That being said not sure I how feel about this game costing money. Sure I think that the devs deserve to get paid but also .. this hasn't been updated since 2017 and problems have arise because of that. At the lowest "Steam DB" discount I say you can argue if you don't mind spending an hour with the concept.

Overall tho for a consideration with the review, it would be nice if the game was updated and polished a bit for modern VR standards/technology codebases for performance optimization and gameplay shake.
Otherwise I had a good time with my HP Reverb G2 (WMR) headset, would recommend for anyone sort on time and want a sitting experience that makes them think. Might be fun for beginners to VR who want to see a good concept done well.

Il faut un bon niveau d'Anglais pour comprendre les instructions et ... l'humour des dialogues russes / américains.
La compléxité de la prise en main du jeu est un peu pertubante au début, mais je crois que c'est tout l'intérêt...paniquer avec tous les instruments et les consignes qui s'enchaînent à la radio.
Une fois que l'on a compris les principales manoeuvres (oxygène, pression, direction, etc.) on commence vraiment à maîtriser, mais c'est forcément moins surprenant.
Superbe expérience !

A fonctionné sur ma 2070
N'a pas fonctionné pas sur ma 3060ti (crash)
Ne fonctionne pas sur ma nouvelle 4070 (crash)
Je pense que ce n'est pas lié à la carte graphique mais à un autre paramètre impossible à identifier, dommage, j'aurais bien aimé refaire un atterrissage en capsule spatiale.

0.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 septembre 2022
Très court (comptez 30 a 45 min) l'experience n'en reste pas moins vraiment très chouette.
C'est une petite histoire rigolote ou l'on passe son temps a suivre des instructions, manipulant une capsule spatial. Faire attention au taux d'oxygene dans la capsule (l'oxygene c'est bien mais si il y en a trop les risques d'incendie angmentent), au taux de CO2, a la pression qui influence la température et evidemment a des instruments de bords pas toujours fiable, le tout dans l'espoir de rejoindre la Terre sans se foirer.

C'est très simplifié mais efficace et assez drole. Pas de quoi rire aux éclats, l'humour se base sur la caricature de la conquete spatial URSS, mais c'est léger et entrainant.

En ce qui me concerne j'ai vraiment pas vu le temps passé et malgré mon niveau d'anglais assez faible j'ai pu faire le jeu de bout en bout sans probleme (on vous donne les instructions en anglais mais c'est assez simple et puis il y a des étiquettes sur tous les appareils et mécanisme de controle).

Je reprocherais juste au jeu d'être aussi "rêche" dans sa proposition, pas de menu d'option, le seul menu existant est pour quitter ou retourner au jeu (et l'UI est a peine digne d'un placeholder d'une version Alpha... mais bon ça marche) et il suffit de voir l'écran de fin (rigolo également) pour se rendre compte que hormis le core-gameplay le reste a vraiment était fait a la zob, sans moyen de fignoler ^_^

Rien de grave car dans les faits tous le reste du jeu est chouette, je regrette juste qu'il n'y ait pas eu quelques options graphique car je trouvais que la résolution était assez faible et qu'on sente aussi clairement qu'aucun effort n'avait était fait sur l'interface. A 5€ c'est un peu cher les 40min mais honnetement si ils sortaient une suite avec disons 4 ou 5 scénario de 30 min, je rempilerais avec grand plaisir pour 20€.

Un erzats de "I Expect You To Die" que je suis heureux d'avoir fait (après je l'ai eu dans un bundle, pour 5€ c'est un peu chiche mais l'experience n'en reste pas moins plaisante)

Évaluation publiée le 10 janvier 2022
In terms of presentation and immersion this game does a pretty good job. The voice acting is pretty good and the effects are immersive and enjoyable.

In terms of gameplay and value, it falls somewhat short, particularly when compared to other space-based VR games. It's painfully short and only offers the illusion of control. Additionally, the window animations that I saw upon entering the atmosphere were lackluster and static, making the landing feel almost like it didn't even happen (all I could see for a while was black then fade to clouds but with no movement).

Still, for a VR experience it is worth trying out but I would recommend waiting for a sale.

Produit reçu gratuitement

I am really torn on this one. On the one hand, I think Interkosmos is a short but nice, well-designed experience, giving you a good feeling of the outer space while keeping the whole thing accessible. The humor is a tiny bit cringy at times, but they doesn't spoil anything.

What I didn't like is simply a series of problems I had with my headset (Reverb G2) and its controllers. At the start of the game, the left hand and the right hand are sometimes swapped, hitting a random combination of keys sometimes bring them back in order. Hitting a (virtual, this time) key by moving your hand towards it sometimes feel a bit unresponsive. But the worst problem I got (several times within less than 2 hours of play) is the total loss of the sound, with no other option than restarting the game. This has been a bit infuriating during one or two games where the captain was explaining what to do next, and I suddenly couldn't hear anything anymore and had to drop that game.

Ok, I'll give a thumbs up this time because it was still a nice experience, but this done bug in particular could be investigated.

Évaluation publiée le 9 juillet 2021
An absolutely dreadful experience. Aside from the hands being switched (right joystick controlling the left hand and vice versa), the tracking in the game itself is sub par. Another problem is the implementation of the knobs and buttons in the capsule, which mess up the tracking so bad, causing utmost frustration.


The game is based on a really good idea though, you're an astronaut aboard an USSR secret spacecraft. The game does a relatively good job portraying the strains between the US and USSR during the cold war with two characters from the opposing sides arguing, while you're just a mute bystander.

All in all, it's a shame the controls make the whole experience fall flat.

Buy when it's on sale for $1. At least it's cheap.

1,266 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
5.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 aout 2020
底下有主要按钮的作用
意外有趣的 充满美苏笑话的 小品级游戏
游戏暂无中文 需要一定的英语能力
游戏内容就是各种操作返回舱（ rcs 主引擎 分离程序 降落 拧阀门维生 毛式修理 毛式抛弃heatsheild）对航空航天题材感兴趣的话还是非常很有意思的
游戏对话和里面充满毛味的英语口音也是游戏体验的重要部分
唯一不满的就是流程太短包括熟悉操作和口音在内半个小时左右）
主要按钮的意思和作用
舱内气体控制
  • 正对面屏幕的下方分别是 氧气阀 两个泄压阀
  • 右侧两个大表盘是宇航服剩余氧气 舱内O2含量和Co2含量 下方开关Co2排放 排放完后自动复位
  • 左侧表盘是温度和气压、
  • 始终保持O2含量 温度 气压 适宜是主要目标
  • 打开Co2排放开关和泄压阀都可降压和降温 大多数时候只用排放Co2即可
  • 过冷和过热都有特效和死法
左下角开关总电源和各个功能（计算机 推进器 维生系统） 注意功耗有限
故障维修在右侧 手动按亮熄灭的电容（？）即可
电脑键盘主要用来输入航向数字 右边俩按钮上确认下清除 右侧开关切换航行数据/姿态
脱离 释压 开伞等操作哪亮按哪
隔热罩打不开？大力出奇迹
左侧扳手乱敲对航天器修复有奇效
For Mother Russssia!!

1.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 juin 2020
This game is a hidden gem worth every bit of the $5 I paid for it. I've spent much more for games I had a lot less fun with. To sum it up, this game is fun. From the moment it starts and you find yourself in a Russian re-entry capsule with everything written in Russian and sparse little pieces of tape with English titles, you're drawn into that world.

Nothing makes sense at first, but there's a nice little clipboard with a drawing of the consoles that surround you. Then the narration/training starts, and it just gets better from there. The voice acting is great; the dialogue funny. Your only job is to keep the capsule on track, while making sure you can breathe and not cause a fire along the way. It sounds simple, because once you figure out the controls it is, but it's never boring. I highly recommend this game - it should be on all the top lists for budget VR games.

1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 mai 2020
One of the gems to come out of the early days of VR, Interkosmos is a short and very sweet experience that's well worth the price of admission.

It becomes obvious pretty much immediately that humor is one of the key goals of this experience. You are a nameless Russian who has apparently stolen a Soyuz containing a nuclear warhead and may or may not be a literal trained monkey.
You have absolutely no idea how to operate the craft you're in, so success or failure will mostly come down to your ability to follow the directions being fed to you while managing a few basic functions of your capsule such as life support, dodgy circuit breakers, and the chaos you inevitably bring upon yourself by hitting things you shouldn't within the cramped confines of the re-entry capsule.

While mission control only gives you a 10% chance of landing successfully, in practice I have to say that most will probably not find winning very difficult. Anyone who goes in with a cool head and listens carefully to the instructions provided will likely be able to land on the first try. As such, I'd definitely recommend that the first thing you do upon loading the game up is switch the difficulty toggle to "hard" mode. This will prevent the game from highlighting the controls which correspond to each instruction you are given. And this is very important because the primary source of the accidents that make the game so fun is you: desperately flailing around in the cockpit trying to read the labels on the controls and failing to notice that you just accidentally fired your engines or smashed your flight computer with a pipe wrench.

You really only get the one chance to go into the game in complete ignorance of how the cockpit works, and if you spoil it for yourself I suspect you're going to find yourself a bit disappointed. Though there are a few elements which suggest there might be some hidden ways to screw things up in a more exotic fashion (such as one with a very ominous/enticing red "Emergency Exit" switch and a mysterious blue push button on the floor simply labeled "3" there really only seem to be three possible endings here: you land in Kazakhstan, you land in American waters, or you don't land at all. Everything else offers a pretty minor variation on those themes. While additional runs can still be fun to listen to the dialog coming in over the radio, it's very hard to create a sense of panic when the only accidents that come about are the result of willful neglect rather than genuine incompetence.

Évaluation publiée le 7 novembre 2019
Fun experience, less than an hour long all choices considered. A gem for its price.

There were some things that I found irksome though:
- The hands are aligned with your controllers rather than trying to be aligned with your actual hands (on Vive)
- As a Russian, I've noticed some inaccuracies (artistic liberties maybe?) , like the "International" (the proletariat anthem) standing in for the Soviet Anthem, or calling the country the "Soviet Empire", or things like getting gulag'd "before the end of the cold war". Last one might've just been a joke, but still had to mention it.
- The game is very linear and won't allow some interactions when the timing isn't appropriate

All in all, for its current price, it's an 8/10. If you liked the submarine level in I Expect You To Die, you'll enjoy this.

1.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 mars 2019
This is a fantastic little game experience; and at $5 bucks, it's an absolute steal, and a great way to show off VR!

It's essentially an 'on-rails' experience, don't go into this thinking this is going to be a flight simulator of any kind. It's more of a problem solving simulator with fun dialogue to tell the story and sort of 'guide' you through the plot. It's about an hour of game-play, maybe double that if you go through both modes (normal & hard), longer or shorter, depending on how long you goof around in the beginning, but there's no hard time limit.

I had a sound problem at first, which I've run into with other VR games - so I can't say if it's the software or hardware, but this sort of thing I've found is easily fixed by alt-tabbing in and out of the game before jumping into the VR set and getting yourself oriented.

Outside of that, the controls are a *bit* clunky - the large gloves never really feel like they're in the right place, so it makes pressing some of the buttons a bit on the annoying side as you find yourself waiting for the glove to catch up with your actual hand movements, but for all I know, pressing buttons in a space suit really is that clumsy feeling. It might have helped if the fingers were animated at least partially instead of permanently in the "finger gun" position.

Those are really my only 2 (1 and a half, really) gripes, and they're tiny, easily overlooked.

If you're enjoying your VR, this is an excellent addition to your collection, and a great little game to get your friends hooked.

It's kinda fun to play around with. It's a $5 VR game, so don't expect an in-depth story or a lot of variety on game play.

With my decent rig and an OC'd GTX 1080, I still get some lag and missed frames, even with high quality effects disabled. That being said, it looks pretty good for being a small game. 0.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 avril 2018
Interkosmos ist (wie die meisten VR-Spiele) recht schnell durchgespielt. Für den günstigen Preis (ich habe rund 5 EUR bezahlt) bekommt man aber ein wirklich cool gemachtes, spannendes Erlebnis, das sich auch lohnt noch mindestens ein weiteres mal durchzuspielen. Warum? Das will ich hier nicht verraten.

Kurz erklärt steuert man eine Raumkapsel nach dem Abdocken von einer Raumstation (ich nehme an, es soll die Mir sein) zurück zur Erde. Allerdings ist das Raumgefährt recht dürftig zusammengezimmert und birgt allerhand Probleme und Bugs (die Raumfähre, nicht das Spiel).

Beim Funkkontakt zwischen Boden- und Raumstation muss man schon ein bisschen zwischen den Zeilen lesen und sich am besten im Nachgang noch mal genau durch den Kopf gehen lassen, was eigentlich gerade passiert ist, um all die kleinen Gags und die eigentlich (hintergründige) Handlung genau zu verstehen.

Das Spiel lohnt sich für jeden, der auf Raumfahrterlebnisse wie Mercury, BBC's Home, Mission ISS und die Apollo 11 Experience steht.

Sehr viel Spaß.
Sehr viel Humor.
Sehr cool gemacht.
Schrottige Raumkapsel, die gerade dadurch einen gewissen Charme hat.
Und optisch macht das ganze auch echt was her.
 
Duster

0.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 janvier 2018
Great little VR game here. Simulates being an cosmonaut, and having to manually land a re-entry capsule while given instructions by radio. The radio commentary is okay, but the whole Amurica freedom thing was a bit overdone and is somewhat cringeworthy - but it's not so bad that it can't be overlooked.

The big problem is that the devs need to fix, is the way that the player interacts with the environment. So many times I will try to push a button and fail. If you press down on the trigger, you get a pointy finger, but if you move that over a switch it doesn't always flip it. And too often when you have your not pointed hand near a switch and pull the trigger, it also doesn't flip the switch. Some sort of force feedback when you are over a switch/knob would be great, or maybe, a bit of a 'snap' of your hand to the button would work too (this would work particularly best for the knobs and levers, a snap when holding the trigger would make sense). Alternatively an outline or visual coloration of the button, just to let you know you are in the right place to interact with the button would also work. Having something like this is pretty important as the biggest challenge of this game is figuring out where and how to place your VR hands in order to successfully interact with the buttons and knobs - and it becomes a huge frustration which sadly breaks the game's immersion. The shielded buttons are especially bad...

Évaluation publiée le 16 septembre 2017
This game took me back to 688 attack sub. Lots of buttons with russian writing on, and me with no idea what to press next :)
On easy mode it does a great job of introducing you to all the commands, turning the indecipherable collection of panels and switches into something managable that you can understand. I'm looking forward to trying the hard mode and attempting to get my capsule home in one piece.
The motion controls can be a little figgity but generally flicking switches and pushing buttons have a nice weight to them and function as planned 90% of the time.
This was a great experience and a good game at a very reasonable price. I would recommend it to anyone with a VR rig.

Évaluation publiée le 16 juin 2017
Eine russische Raumkapsel von der Raumstation zurück zur Erde bringen? Hört sich spassig an.
Ist es auch - wenn man die der englischen Sprache mächtig ist und die Sprachausgabe mit russischem Akzent versteht.

Die Aufgabe im Spiel ist es von einer russischen Raumstation im Erdorbit sicher zurück zur Erde zu fliegen. In der Raumkapsel kann man so ziemlich jeden Schalter und Knopf bedienen. Dabei muss man darauf achten, das der Eintritt korrekt ausgeführt wird und natürlich das man die Lebenserhaltung an Bord korrekt arbeitet... Aber wie man das von russischer Technik kennt ;) geht einiges schief.

Kurzweiliges Spiel mit sehr guter Immersion - Spaßig und doch beklemmend, den Preis von ~5 EUR auf jedenfall Wert

P.S.: Ja, und russische Technik ist doch garnicht so schlecht.

Évaluation publiée le 9 mai 2017
I'm giving this a very weak reccomendation. It feels like an Early Access game when it isn't.

The graphics are great but unoptimized to a point where there's lag in the hands. It's an OK sitdown experience with some chuckles here and there. There is 17 achievements and I beat the 20-40ish minute game with both endings. I got none of them. That part eludes me.

The hands in the game lag as I've said before. The main menu has a demonstration controller that shows what button does what. It sits right in front of the player and it has physics, meaning it's in the way of the main menu. The fingers on the gloves have a large hit box and the switches are tiny. So there is a lot of 'fingers too fat' situations where I had to jam my sausage fingers (heh) in the switches to make them flip. Too often where I make too frantic movements, I accidently press something and kill myself. The buttons are highlighted so I know what to press, it is just nearby another button that I'm not supposed to press. Knowing what to press and unable to press it causes the Russians to repeat the same command over and over again. So jank buttons + fat fingers + laggy hands + annoying Russian command center = frustrations.

It is redundant to bring up 'at least the price is ok' because I don't think the price justifies buying this. The win screen looks pretty half assed on both endings. The "You Win" part looks like it was cobbled together with rectangle brick primatives in the unreal engine.

I'd say, wait until they patch it or get a beefier computer. My computer is pretty beef, it can handle Rick and Morty and Job Simulator but I do not know what to think about this one. It seems polished but it needs a good spit shine here and there to be worthy of the $5 price.

Évaluation publiée le 30 avril 2017
Upfront you should be aware that his is not a long game. It takes about 15-20 minutes to complete the landing sequence. BUT it is priced appropriately.

This is the best VR experiance I have ever had. You put on the headset and are immediatly surrounded by conrtol panels and dials, all of which you manipulate with your real hands. They use a retro, soviet style in e very clever way to make the switches bulkier than normal so they are easier to use in VR, but you don't really notice.

I would gladly pay $60 for this game if it had more missions. I really hope they come up with a sequal, because as of right now they have a full-featured cockpit that can accuratly simulate anything a Soyuz capsul can do, so making more missions shuoldn't be that hard.

I must also say that sometimes the headset lost position in the cockpit (1 button push to fix)(happens on average 1 time every ten minute play thru) and it's a bit tricky to hit a few of the virtual switches.

This is the best VR experiance I've ever had and it's a great way to introduce your friends to seated VR - though the archery game in The Lab is the best introduction to roomscale.
